topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a2ea50636872570400076c#post_55a2ea50636872570400076c
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a2ea12636872629d000195#post_55a2ea12636872629d000195
BUT SHE REALLY DID NOTHING WRONG THOUGH![/bq]
If someone is a unrepentant monster who no matter what will continue to kill people you can't fault the person who stops them from killing anyone else while they're in the process of killing people.

When you get down to it the reason why the people that go "it was wrong for homura to do that" are full of it is that if killing was 100% all the time fundamentally wrong then that would mean the idea of police or such would be fundamentally evil.


To use an analogy if you were a police officer that walks in on a serial killer that is putting people on meathooks in a meat processing plant and dumping them into the meat grinder and their response to you pointing a gun at them and telling them to stop is to push the button again and drop another person into the grinder would it be evil to put a bullet in them when they obviously don't give a fuck and will continue to keep pushing the button so long as they're alive?


Saying that Homura did something wrong is like saying that people who stop serial killers are evil simply cause often times serial killers think they're doing the right thing.
